sentences: Teda ei ole enam elavate kirjas.
Ta peaks nüüd õige vana olema, ei tea, kas ongi enam elavate kirjas.
Seekord leinas laev elavate kirjast lahkunud kaptenit, kes möödunud ööl laevajuhi-kohustused igaveseks maha pani.
context: The phrase 'elavate kirjas' is an idiomatic expression in Estonian meaning to be among the living, i.e., to be alive. It appears to be derived from a literal translation concept where one would be written in the book of the living, similar to biblical concepts. The phrase is typically used in contexts discussing whether someone is still alive or has passed away.
